org.usfirst.frc.team449.robot.oi.unidirectional

Interface OIUnidirectional

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Loggable, OI, Updatable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OIArcade, OIArcadeSimple, OIArcadeWithDPad, OIOutreach, OITank, OITankSimple

    public interface OIUnidirectional
extends OI
    An OI to control a robot with a unidirectional drive that has a left and right side (e.g. not meccanum, swerve, or holonomic)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean commandingStraight()
      Whether the driver is trying to drive straight.
      double[] getFwdRotOutput()
      The forwards and rotational movement given to the drive.
      double[] getFwdRotOutputCached()
      The cached forwards and rotational movement given to the drive.
      double[] getLeftRightOutput()
      The output to be given to the left and right sides of the drive.
      double[] getLeftRightOutputCached()
      The cached output to be given to the left and right sides of the drive.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.usfirst.frc.team449.robot.generalInterfaces.updatable.Updatable

        update

      • Methods inherited from interface org.usfirst.frc.team449.robot.generalInterfaces.loggable.Loggable

        getData, getHeader, getLogName

    • Method Detail

      • getLeftRightOutput

        double[] getLeftRightOutput()
        The output to be given to the left and right sides of the drive.
        Returns:
        An array of length 2, where the 1st element is the output for the left and the second for the right, both from [-1, 1].

      • getLeftRightOutputCached

        double[] getLeftRightOutputCached()
        The cached output to be given to the left and right sides of the drive.
        Returns:
        An array of length 2, where the 1st element is the output for the left and the second for the right, both from [-1, 1].

      • getFwdRotOutput

        double[] getFwdRotOutput()
        The forwards and rotational movement given to the drive.
        Returns:
        An array of length 2, where the first element is the forwards output and the second is the rotational, both from [-1, 1]

      • getFwdRotOutputCached

        double[] getFwdRotOutputCached()
        The cached forwards and rotational movement given to the drive.
        Returns:
        An array of length 2, where the first element is the forwards output and the second is the rotational, both from [-1, 1]

      • commandingStraight

        boolean commandingStraight()
        Whether the driver is trying to drive straight.
        Returns:
        True if the driver is trying to drive straight, false otherwise.
